coding_philosophy.value: Pragmatism is non-negotiable. Clean, testable code through small bold increments. Simplicity over cleverness.

response_style_preference.value: Concise and direct. Add detail only for complexity, obscurity, or explicit request.

repo_name.value: ai-assistants-cfg (GitHub) / ai-assistants (local) -- configuration repository for AI coding assistants (Claude Code, Claude Desktop)

skill_convention.value: Skills use progressive disclosure: metadata at startup, full SKILL.md on activation, references/ on demand. Aim for ~500 lines.

collaboration_style.value: Pragmatic, direct, values purposeful incremental evolution. Prefers proactive agent usage and minimal unnecessary explanation.

version_control.value: git with gh CLI. Commit conventions: imperative mood, type prefix (feat/fix/refactor/docs/test/chore), under 50 chars.

proactive_memory_retrieval.value: Always read memory.json at session start BEFORE any interaction. Check stored context before asking questions — the answer may already be in memory. Memory-first, ask-second.

skill-crafting-reengineering.value: Reengineered skill-crafting using official Anthropic skill-creator as guide. Key patterns: (1) Move creation-time guidance to init_skill.py template to save SKILL.md tokens -- template is only "spent" once during scaffolding. (2) Stdlib-only YAML parsing works for skill frontmatter (flat key-value pairs, no nested structures needed) -- regex handles single-line, folded scalar >, literal scalar |, indented continuations. (3) Content type table (scripts/worked examples/prose) is complementary to bundled resources (scripts/references/assets) -- different axes, not redundant. (4) Reference file header convention: "# Title" + one-line description + back-link "Reference material for the [Skill Name](../SKILL.md) skill." (5) Rename files with git mv + update all references in same commit to avoid broken links at any commit boundary.

user-overrides-over-research.value: Always check for explicit user overrides before following research/plan recommendations. In the skill-crafting reengineering, research recommended keeping name field optional (K5, R2) but user explicitly overrode this to require name, matching the official standard. The override simplified implementation and eliminated a reconciliation point.

line-count-estimates-rough.value: Line count estimates for markdown files are rough guides, not targets. Plan estimated ~55 lines for output-patterns.md (actual: 85) and ~40 for workflows.md (actual: 48). Extra lines from richer examples add practical value -- don't trim useful content to match an estimate.

skill-implementation-patterns.value: Patterns from building claude-ecosystem skill via full pipeline: (1) Place satellite file listing immediately after intro, before content sections. (2) Use sub-headed tables (### per category) instead of one giant table for scannable API feature maps. (3) Run validate.py early to catch frontmatter issues. (4) Add explicit Boundary notes at top of reference files to prevent overlap with adjacent skills. (5) For SDK references, combine code examples (init + message + streaming in one block) and note "same API shape" for TS to avoid duplication — cut 357 to 198 lines. (6) Docs maps work best as "I need to..." / "Go to" intent-mapping tables. (7) Split operations vs features across reference files (what parameters vs how to run efficiently) with cross-references.

parallel-implementer-workflow.value: When running multiple implementer agents in parallel: (1) Steps with content dependencies must be sequential (api-features before sdk-patterns, since SDK patterns reference API features). (2) Steps with disjoint file sets and no shared content can run in parallel (docs-map and platform-services). (3) WIP.md tracking breaks when main agent does final steps directly instead of via implementer — update WIP.md manually or skip steps 6-7 in the plan.

architecture-gap-registration-files.value: Systems plans can miss downstream registration files. When adding a new agent or artifact that produces output documents, check: (1) plugin.json agents array, (2) coordination protocol tables (4 places), (3) agent-intermediate-documents.md (file tree + lifecycle table), (4) agents/README.md (count, diagram, table, plugin example). The implementation planner caught the agent-intermediate-documents.md gap for skill-genesis.
